info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 29 at 1:36PM PST until December 30 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected, with total accumulations of 3 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40-45 mph in the Warner Mountains and 30-35 mph at lower elevations. * WHERE...Modoc County, mostly the higher terrain, including the Warner Mountains and a portion of highway 299 at Cedar Pass. This also includes Willow Ranch and a portion of highway 395. * WHEN...For only the Warner Mountains- from 4 PM this afternoon to 2 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level starts out around 4500 feet and snow over much of the county is expected too. Then by around 10 PM PST the snow level rises to around 5500 feet and the snow will largely be contained to the mountains. The snow level should hover between 5500 and 6000 feet through late Friday morning, then remain around 6000 feet through Friday evening. For this reason, the Warner Mountains specifically, remain under the advisory through 2 PM PST, when all other areas have the advisory ending early in the day on Friday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
